title: Combating Unfair Practices in the Live Entertainment Market

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to enforce laws that prevent unfair ticketing practices in the live entertainment market, including stopping scalpers from using bots to buy tickets and resell at high markups. It aims to protect concertgoers and artists by promoting price transparency and cracking down on deceptive and anti-competitive behaviors in both primary and secondary ticket markets.
potential_concerns: Enforcement may be challenging due to the technical complexity of monitoring and regulating ticket resale practices and bots.
Regulations may increase operational costs for ticketing agencies, potentially leading to higher baseline ticket prices.
Secondary ticket markets might find ways to circumvent rules, continuing consumer harm despite enforcement.
Collaboration between federal and state agencies may face jurisdictional or resource coordination obstacles.
The order lacks specific mechanisms to involve consumer advocacy groups or create permanent oversight structures.
